From harbour@matrixlist.com  Fri Mar 30 07:33:02 2001
From: harbour@matrixlist.com (=?iso-8859-1?Q?Horacio_Rold=E1n?=)
Date: Fri Mar 30 07:33:02 2001
Subject: [Harbour] Unlimited File Handles
References: <LOBBKAFMMFGJIKLMEPAKOEMCDKAA.Ron@Profit-Master.com>
Message-ID: <031101c0b915$43ccf050$f003a8c0@ksoft20000507>

This is a multi-part message in MIME format.

------=_NextPart_000_030E_01C0B8FC.1DB5FFB0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Ron (or/and anyone with spare time )

I fixed the FRead problem (it was actually a FOpen problem), but doing that
I discovered other problems with the win32 routines (especially error
checking).
I fixed them: (hb_fsClose, hb_fsRead, hb_fsWrite, hb_fsReadLarge,
hb_fsWriteLarge, hb_fsSeek, hb_fsTell).

Many filesys.c routines works with handles but they didn't had support for
win32, so they failed as it seems that the "normal" handles (eg: open() )
are not compatible with the ones from the win32 api (Createfile).
I added support for: hb_fsEof , hb_fsCommit, hb_fsLock, convert_seek_flags.

I don't cvs'ed the file because of two reasons:
- asking for testing (the file is attached)
- there is still potencial incompatibilities with handles not created with
hb_fsOpen (I found them in console.c at least)

I was wondering to flag the handles opened with the win32 api in order to
keep compatibility with the normal handles. That mark would be a 0x4000:
if  ( (handle & 0xC000) == 0x4000)
  handle_win32 = handle & 0x3FFF; // and routines for win32
else
  // normal routines from C compiler

This should work (unless windows uses a file handle in that range!)
I would like to hear opinions !

regards
Horacio

------=_NextPart_000_030E_01C0B8FC.1DB5FFB0
Content-Type: application/octet-stream;
	name="filesys.c"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Disposition: attachment;
	filename="filesys.c"

/*
 * $Id: filesys.c,v 1.149 2001/02/28 08:11:27 ronpinkas Exp $
 */

/*
 * Harbour Project source code:
 * The FileSys API (C level)
 *
 * Copyright 1999 {list of individual authors and e-mail addresses}
 * www - http://www.harbour-project.org
 *
 * This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
 * it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
 * the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or
 * (at your option) any later version, with one exception:
 *
 * The exception is that if you link the Harbour Runtime Library (HRL)
 * and/or the Harbour Virtual Machine (HVM) with other files to produce
 * an executable, this does not by itself cause the resulting executable
 * to be covered by the GNU General Public License. Your use of that
 * executable is in no way restricted on account of linking the HRL
 * and/or HVM code into it.
 *
 * This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
 * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
 * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
 * GNU General Public License for more details.
 *
 * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
 * along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software
 * Foundation, Inc., 675 Mass Ave, Cambridge, MA 02139, USA (or visit
 * their web site at http://www.gnu.org/).
 *
 */

/*
 * The following parts are Copyright of the individual authors.
 * www - http://www.harbour-project.org
 *
 * Copyright 1999 Victor Szakats <info@szelvesz.hu>
 *    hb_fsSetError()
 *    hb_fsSetDevMode()
 *    hb_fsReadLarge()
 *    hb_fsWriteLarge()
 *    hb_fsCurDirBuff()
 *
 * Copyright 1999 Jose Lalin <dezac@corevia.com>
 *    hb_fsChDrv()
 *    hb_fsCurDrv()
 *    hb_fsIsDrv()
 *    hb_fsIsDevice()
 *
 * Copyright 2000 Luiz Rafael Culik <culik@sl.conex.net>
 *            and David G. Holm <dholm@jsd-llc.com>
 *    hb_fsEof()
 *
 * Copyright 2001 Jose Gimenez (JFG) <jfgimenez@wanadoo.es>
 *                                   <tecnico.sireinsa@ctv.es>
 *    Added __WIN32__ check for any compiler to use the Win32
 *    API calls to allow openning an unlimited number of files
 *    simultaneously.
 *
 * See doc/license.txt for licensing terms.
 *
 */

/* NOTE: In DOS/DJGPP under WinNT4 hb_fsSeek( fhnd, offset < 0, FS_SET) =
will
         set the file pointer to the passed negative value, and the =
subsequent
         hb_fsWrite() call will fail. In CA-Clipper hb_fsSeek() will =
fail,
         the pointer will not be moved, and thus the hb_fsWrite() call =
will
         successfully write the buffer to the current file position. =
[vszakats]

   This has been corrected by ptucker
 */

#include <ctype.h>

#include "hbapi.h"
#include "hbapifs.h"

#if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__MINGW32__)
   #include <sys/types.h>
   #include <sys/stat.h>
   #include <unistd.h>
   #include <fcntl.h>
   #include <errno.h>

   #if !defined(OS_UNIX_COMPATIBLE)
      #include <io.h>
   #endif
   #if defined(__DJGPP__)
      #include <dir.h>
      #define _getdrive getdisk
      #define _chdrive  setdisk
   #endif

   #if !defined(HAVE_POSIX_IO)
      #define HAVE_POSIX_IO
   #endif

   extern int rename( const char *, const char * );

#endif

#if defined(__WATCOMC__)
   #include <sys/stat.h>
   #include <share.h>
   #include <fcntl.h>
   #include <io.h>
   #include <direct.h>
   #include <errno.h>
   #include <dos.h>

   #if !defined(HAVE_POSIX_IO)
      #define HAVE_POSIX_IO
   #endif
   #define ftruncate chsize
#endif

#if defined(__BORLANDC__) || defined(__IBMCPP__) || defined(_MSC_VER) || =
defined(__MINGW32__)
   #include <sys\stat.h>
   #include <share.h>
   #include <fcntl.h>
   #include <io.h>
   #include <direct.h>
   #if defined(__BORLANDC__)
      #include <dir.h>
      #include <dos.h>
      #include <windows.h>
   #endif

   #if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__)
      #include <sys\locking.h>
      #define ftruncate _chsize
   #else
      #define ftruncate chsize
      #if !defined(HAVE_POSIX_IO)
         #define HAVE_POSIX_IO
      #endif
   #endif
   #include <errno.h>
#endif

#if defined(__MPW__)
   #include <fcntl.h>
#endif

#if defined(HB_OS_DOS)
   #include <dos.h>
#endif

#ifndef O_BINARY
   #define O_BINARY     0       /* O_BINARY not defined on Linux */
#endif

#ifndef S_IEXEC
   #define S_IEXEC      0x0040  /* owner may execute <directory search> =
*/
#endif

#ifndef S_IRWXU
   #define S_IRWXU      0x01C0  /* RWE permissions mask for owner */
#endif

#ifndef S_IRUSR
   #define S_IRUSR      0x0100  /* owner may read */
#endif

#ifndef S_IWUSR
   #define S_IWUSR      0x0080  /* owner may write */
#endif

#ifndef S_IXUSR
   #define S_IXUSR      0x0040  /* owner may execute <directory search> =
*/
#endif

#ifndef SH_COMPAT
   #define SH_COMPAT    0x00    /* Compatibility */
#endif

#ifndef SH_DENYRW
   #define SH_DENYRW    0x10    /* Deny read/write */
#endif

#ifndef SH_DENYWR
   #define SH_DENYWR    0x20    /* Deny write */
#endif

#ifndef SH_DENYRD
   #define SH_DENYRD    0x30    /* Deny read */
#endif

#ifndef SH_DENYNO
   #define SH_DENYNO    0x40    /* Deny nothing */
#endif

static USHORT s_uiErrorLast =3D 0;

#if defined(HAVE_POSIX_IO) || defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__)
/* Only compilers with Posix or Posix-like I/O support are supported */
   #define HB_FS_FILE_IO
#endif

#if defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__) || defined(__IBMCPP__) || =
defined(__WATCOMC__)
/* These compilers use sopen() rather than open(), because their
   versions of open() do not support combined O_ and SH_ flags */
   #define HB_FS_SOPEN
#endif

#if ( defined(HAVE_POSIX_IO) && ( defined(HB_OS_OS2) || =
defined(HB_OS_DOS) || defined(_Windows) || defined(_WIN32) ) && ! =
defined(__CYGWIN__) ) || defined(__MINGW32__)
/* These platforms and/or compilers have common drive letter support */
   #define HB_FS_DRIVE_LETTER
#endif

#if UINT_MAX =3D=3D ULONG_MAX
   #define HB_FS_LARGE_OPTIMIZED
#else
   #define LARGE_MAX ( UINT_MAX - 1L )
#endif

/* Convert HARBOUR flags to IO subsystem flags */

#if defined(HB_FS_FILE_IO)

static int convert_open_flags( USHORT uiFlags )
{
   /* by default FO_READ + FO_COMPAT is set */
   int result_flags =3D 0;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("convert_open_flags(%hu)", uiFlags));

   result_flags |=3D O_BINARY;
   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_INFO, ("convert_open_flags: added O_BINARY\n"));

#if defined(HB_FS_SOPEN)
   if( ( uiFlags & ( FO_WRITE | FO_READWRITE ) ) =3D=3D FO_READ )
   {
      result_flags |=3D O_RDONLY;
      HB_TRACE(HB_TR_INFO, ("convert_open_flags: added O_RDONLY\n"));
   }
#else

   if( ( uiFlags & ( FO_WRITE | FO_READWRITE ) ) =3D=3D FO_READ )
   {
      result_flags |=3D ( O_RDONLY | SH_COMPAT );
      HB_TRACE(HB_TR_INFO, ("convert_open_flags: added O_RDONLY =
SH_COMPAT\n"));
   }
#endif

   /* read & write flags */
   if( uiFlags & FO_WRITE )
   {
      result_flags |=3D O_WRONLY;
      HB_TRACE(HB_TR_INFO, ("convert_open_flags: added O_WRONLY\n"));
   }

   if( uiFlags & FO_READWRITE )
   {
      result_flags |=3D O_RDWR;
      HB_TRACE(HB_TR_INFO, ("convert_open_flags: added O_RDWR\n"));
   }

#if ! defined(HB_FS_SOPEN)
   /* shared flags */
   if( ( uiFlags & FO_DENYREAD ) =3D=3D FO_DENYREAD )
   {
      result_flags |=3D SH_DENYRD;
      HB_TRACE(HB_TR_INFO, ("convert_open_flags: added SH_DENYRD\n"));
   }

   else if( uiFlags & FO_EXCLUSIVE )
   {
      result_flags |=3D SH_DENYRW;
      HB_TRACE(HB_TR_INFO, ("convert_open_flags: added SH_DENYRW\n"));
   }

   else if( uiFlags & FO_DENYWRITE )
   {
      result_flags |=3D SH_DENYWR;
      HB_TRACE(HB_TR_INFO, ("convert_open_flags: added SH_DENYWR\n"));
   }

   if( uiFlags & FO_DENYNONE )
   {
      result_flags |=3D SH_DENYNO;
      HB_TRACE(HB_TR_INFO, ("convert_open_flags: added SH_DENYNO\n"));
   }

   if( uiFlags & FO_SHARED )
   {
      result_flags |=3D SH_DENYNO;
      HB_TRACE(HB_TR_INFO, ("convert_open_flags: added SH_DENYNO\n"));
   }
#endif

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_INFO, ("convert_open_flags: result is 0x%04x\n", =
result_flags));

   return result_flags;
}

static int convert_seek_flags( USHORT uiFlags )
{
   /* by default FS_SET is set */
   int result_flags =3D SEEK_SET;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("convert_seek_flags(%hu)", uiFlags));

   #if defined(__WIN32__)

     switch ( uiFlags )
     {
        case FS_SET :
          result_flags =3D FILE_BEGIN;
          break;
        case FS_RELATIVE :
          result_flags =3D FILE_CURRENT;
          break;
        case FS_END :
          result_flags =3D FILE_END;
          break;
     }

   #else
      if( uiFlags & FS_RELATIVE )
         result_flags =3D SEEK_CUR;

      if( uiFlags & FS_END )
         result_flags =3D SEEK_END;
   #endif

   return result_flags;
}

static void convert_create_flags( USHORT uiFlags, int * result_flags, =
unsigned * result_pmode )
{
   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("convert_create_flags(%hu, %p, %p)", uiFlags, =
result_flags, result_pmode));

   /* by default FC_NORMAL is set */

   *result_flags =3D O_BINARY | O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_RDWR;
   *result_pmode =3D S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR;

   if( uiFlags & FC_READONLY )
   {
      *result_pmode =3D S_IRUSR;
      HB_TRACE(HB_TR_INFO, ("convert_create_flags: S_IRUSR"));
   }

   if( uiFlags & FC_HIDDEN )
      *result_flags |=3D 0;

   if( uiFlags & FC_SYSTEM )
      *result_flags |=3D 0;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_INFO, ("convert_create_flags: 0x%04x, 0x%04x\n", =
*result_flags, *result_pmode));
}

#endif


/*
 * FILESYS.API FUNCTIONS --
 */

FHANDLE hb_fsOpen( BYTE * pFilename, USHORT uiFlags )
{
   FHANDLE hFileHandle;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsOpen(%p, %hu)", pFilename, uiFlags));

#if defined(__WIN32__)

   {
      DWORD dwFlags =3D 0;
      DWORD dwShare =3D FILE_SHARE_READ | FILE_SHARE_WRITE;

      // read & write flags
      switch ( uiFlags )
      {
         case FO_READ:
            dwFlags =3D GENERIC_READ;
            break;
         case FO_WRITE:
            dwFlags =3D GENERIC_WRITE;
            break;
         case FO_READWRITE:
            dwFlags =3D GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE;
            break;
      }

      // shared flags
      if( ( uiFlags & FO_DENYREAD ) =3D=3D FO_DENYREAD )
         dwShare =3D FILE_SHARE_WRITE;

      else if( uiFlags & FO_DENYWRITE )
         dwShare =3D FILE_SHARE_READ;

      else if( uiFlags & FO_EXCLUSIVE )
         dwShare =3D 0;

      errno =3D 0;

      hFileHandle =3D ( FHANDLE ) CreateFile( ( char * ) pFilename, =
dwFlags,
                dwShare, NULL, OPEN_EXISTING, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL, =
NULL );

      if( hFileHandle =3D=3D ( FHANDLE ) INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE )
         errno =3D GetLastError();

      s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
   }

#elif defined(HAVE_POSIX_IO) && ! defined(__IBMCPP__)

   errno =3D 0;
   hFileHandle =3D open( ( char * ) pFilename, convert_open_flags( =
uiFlags ) );
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#elif defined(_MSC_VER)

   {
      int iShare =3D _SH_DENYNO;

      if( ( uiFlags & FO_DENYREAD ) =3D=3D FO_DENYREAD )
         iShare =3D _SH_DENYRD;

      else if( uiFlags & FO_EXCLUSIVE )
         iShare =3D _SH_DENYRW;

      else if( uiFlags & FO_DENYWRITE )
         iShare =3D _SH_DENYWR;

      errno =3D 0;
      if( iShare )
         hFileHandle =3D _sopen( ( char * ) pFilename, =
convert_open_flags( uiFlags ), iShare );
      else
         hFileHandle =3D _open( ( char * ) pFilename, =
convert_open_flags( uiFlags ) );
      s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
   }

#elif defined(__MINGW32__) || defined(__IBMCPP__)

   {
      int iShare =3D SH_DENYNO;

      if( ( uiFlags & FO_DENYREAD ) =3D=3D FO_DENYREAD )
         iShare =3D SH_DENYRD;

      else if( uiFlags & FO_EXCLUSIVE )
         iShare =3D SH_DENYRW;

      else if( uiFlags & FO_DENYWRITE )
         iShare =3D SH_DENYWR;

      errno =3D 0;
      if( iShare )
         hFileHandle =3D sopen( ( char * ) pFilename, =
convert_open_flags( uiFlags ), iShare );
      else
         hFileHandle =3D open( ( char * ) pFilename, convert_open_flags( =
uiFlags ) );
      s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
   }

#else

   hFileHandle =3D FS_ERROR;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return hFileHandle;
}

FHANDLE hb_fsCreate( BYTE * pFilename, USHORT uiFlags )
{
   FHANDLE hFileHandle;
   int oflag;
   unsigned pmode;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsCreate(%p, %hu)", pFilename, uiFlags));

   s_uiErrorLast =3D 0;

#if defined(__WIN32__)

   {
      DWORD dwFlags =3D FILE_ATTRIBUTE_ARCHIVE;

      if( uiFlags & FC_READONLY )
         dwFlags |=3D FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY;

      if( uiFlags & FC_HIDDEN )
         dwFlags |=3D FILE_ATTRIBUTE_HIDDEN;

      if( uiFlags & FC_SYSTEM )
         dwFlags |=3D FILE_ATTRIBUTE_SYSTEM;

      errno =3D 0;

      hFileHandle =3D ( FHANDLE ) CreateFile( ( char * ) pFilename,
                    GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE, 0, NULL, =
CREATE_ALWAYS,
                    dwFlags, NULL );

      if( hFileHandle =3D=3D ( FHANDLE ) INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE )
         errno =3D GetLastError();

      s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
   }

#elif defined(HB_FS_FILE_IO)

   errno =3D 0;
   convert_create_flags( uiFlags, &oflag, &pmode );
   hFileHandle =3D open( ( char * ) pFilename, oflag, pmode );
   if( hFileHandle =3D=3D -1 )
   {
      /* This if block is required, because errno will be set
         if the file did not exist and had to be created, even
         when the create is successful! */
      s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
   }

#else

   hFileHandle =3D FS_ERROR;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return hFileHandle;
}

void    hb_fsClose( FHANDLE hFileHandle )
{
   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsClose(%p)", hFileHandle));

#if defined(HB_FS_FILE_IO)

   errno =3D 0;

   #if defined(__WIN32__)
      if ( !CloseHandle( ( HANDLE ) hFileHandle ) )
         errno =3D GetLastError();
   #else
      close( hFileHandle );
   #endif

   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#else

   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   /* Convert 'Invalid Memory Block' to 'Invalid Handle' */
   if( s_uiErrorLast =3D=3D 9 )
      s_uiErrorLast =3D 6;
}

void    hb_fsSetDevMode( FHANDLE hFileHandle, USHORT uiDevMode )
{
   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsSetDevMode(%p, %hu)", hFileHandle, =
uiDevMode));

#if defined(__BORLANDC__) || defined(__IBMCPP__) || defined(__DJGPP__) =
|| defined(__CYGWIN__) || defined(__WATCOMC__)

   errno =3D 0;
   switch( uiDevMode )
   {
      case FD_BINARY:
         setmode( hFileHandle, O_BINARY );
         break;

      case FD_TEXT:
         setmode( hFileHandle, O_TEXT );
         break;
   }
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#elif defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__)

   errno =3D 0;
   switch( uiDevMode )
   {
      case FD_BINARY:
         _setmode( hFileHandle, _O_BINARY );
         break;

      case FD_TEXT:
         _setmode( hFileHandle, _O_TEXT );
         break;
   }
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#else

   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

}

void    hb_fsSetDevRaw( FHANDLE hFileHandle )
{
   hb_fsSetDevMode( hFileHandle, FD_BINARY );
}

void    hb_fsSetDevText( FHANDLE hFileHandle )
{
   hb_fsSetDevMode( hFileHandle, FD_TEXT );
}

USHORT  hb_fsRead( FHANDLE hFileHandle, BYTE * pBuff, USHORT uiCount )
{
   USHORT uiRead;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsRead(%p, %p, %hu)", hFileHandle, pBuff, =
uiCount));

#if defined(HB_FS_FILE_IO)

   errno =3D 0;

   #if defined(__WIN32__)
      {
         DWORD dwRead =3D 0;

         if ( !ReadFile( ( HANDLE ) hFileHandle, pBuff, uiCount, =
&dwRead, NULL ) )
            errno =3D GetLastError();
         uiRead =3D ( USHORT ) dwRead;
      }
   #else
      uiRead =3D read( hFileHandle, pBuff, uiCount );
   #endif

   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
   if( uiRead =3D=3D ( USHORT ) -1 )
      uiRead =3D 0;

#else

   uiRead =3D 0;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return uiRead;
}

USHORT  hb_fsWrite( FHANDLE hFileHandle, BYTE * pBuff, USHORT uiCount )
{
   USHORT uiWritten;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsWrite(%p, %p, %hu)", hFileHandle, pBuff, =
uiCount));

#if defined(HB_FS_FILE_IO)

   errno =3D 0;

   #if defined(__WIN32__)
      {
         DWORD dwWritten =3D 0;

         if (! WriteFile( ( HANDLE ) hFileHandle, pBuff, uiCount, =
&dwWritten, NULL ) )
            errno =3D GetLastError();
         uiWritten =3D ( USHORT ) dwWritten;
      }
   #else

      if( uiCount )
      {
         uiWritten =3D write( hFileHandle, pBuff, uiCount );
         if( uiWritten =3D=3D ( USHORT ) -1 )
            uiWritten =3D 0;
      }
      else
      {
         uiWritten =3D 0;
         ftruncate( hFileHandle, lseek( hFileHandle, 0L, SEEK_CUR ) );
      }
      s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

   #endif

#else

   uiWritten =3D 0;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return uiWritten;
}

ULONG   hb_fsReadLarge( FHANDLE hFileHandle, BYTE * pBuff, ULONG ulCount =
)
{
   ULONG ulRead;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsReadLarge(%p, %p, %lu)", hFileHandle, =
pBuff, ulCount));

#if defined(HB_FS_FILE_IO)

   errno =3D 0;

   #if defined(__WIN32__)
      if ( !ReadFile( ( HANDLE ) hFileHandle, pBuff, ulCount, &ulRead, =
NULL ) )
        errno =3D GetLastError();
   #elif defined(HB_FS_LARGE_OPTIMIZED)
      ulRead =3D read( hFileHandle, pBuff, ulCount );
   #else
      {
         ULONG ulLeftToRead =3D ulCount;
         USHORT uiToRead;
         USHORT uiRead;
         BYTE * pPtr =3D pBuff;

         ulRead =3D 0;

         while( ulLeftToRead )
         {
            /* Determine how much to read this time */
            if( ulLeftToRead > ( ULONG ) INT_MAX )
            {
               uiToRead =3D INT_MAX;
               ulLeftToRead -=3D ( ULONG ) uiToRead;
            }
            else
            {
               uiToRead =3D ( USHORT ) ulLeftToRead;
               ulLeftToRead =3D 0L;
            }
            uiRead =3D read( hFileHandle, pPtr, uiToRead );
            /* -1 on bad hFileHandle
                0 on disk full
             */
            if( uiRead =3D=3D ( USHORT ) -1 || uiRead =3D=3D 0 )
               break;

            ulRead +=3D ( ULONG ) uiRead;
            pPtr +=3D uiRead;
         }
      }
   #endif
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#else

   ulRead =3D 0;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return ulRead;
}

ULONG   hb_fsWriteLarge( FHANDLE hFileHandle, BYTE * pBuff, ULONG =
ulCount )
{
   ULONG ulWritten;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsWriteLarge(%p, %p, %lu)", hFileHandle, =
pBuff, ulCount));

#if defined(HB_FS_FILE_IO)

   errno =3D 0;

   #if defined(__WIN32__)
      if ( !WriteFile( ( HANDLE ) hFileHandle, pBuff, ulCount, =
&ulWritten, NULL ) )
        errno =3D GetLastError();
   #else
      if( ulCount )
      #if defined(HB_FS_LARGE_OPTIMIZED)
         ulWritten =3D write( hFileHandle, pBuff, ulCount );
      #else
         {
            ULONG ulLeftToWrite =3D ulCount;
            USHORT uiToWrite;
            USHORT uiWritten;
            BYTE * pPtr =3D pBuff;

            ulWritten =3D 0;

            while( ulLeftToWrite )
            {
               /* Determine how much to write this time */
               if( ulLeftToWrite > ( ULONG ) INT_MAX )
               {
                  uiToWrite =3D INT_MAX;
                  ulLeftToWrite -=3D ( ULONG ) uiToWrite;
               }
               else
               {
                  uiToWrite =3D ( USHORT ) ulLeftToWrite;
                  ulLeftToWrite =3D 0L;
               }
               uiWritten =3D write( hFileHandle, pPtr, uiToWrite );
               /* -1 on bad hFileHandle
                   0 on disk full
                */
               if( uiWritten =3D=3D ( USHORT ) -1 || uiWritten =3D=3D 0 =
)
                  break;

               ulWritten +=3D ( ULONG ) uiWritten;
               pPtr +=3D uiWritten;
            }
         }
      #endif
      else
      {
         ulWritten =3D 0;
         ftruncate( hFileHandle, lseek( hFileHandle, 0L, SEEK_CUR ) );
      }
   #endif

   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#else

   ulWritten =3D 0;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return ulWritten;
}

ULONG   hb_fsSeek( FHANDLE hFileHandle, LONG lOffset, USHORT uiFlags )
{
   ULONG ulPos;
   USHORT Flags;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsSeek(%p, %ld, %hu)", hFileHandle, =
lOffset, uiFlags));

   Flags =3D convert_seek_flags( uiFlags );

   if( lOffset < 0 && Flags =3D=3D SEEK_SET )
   {

   #if defined(HB_OS_OS2)

      {
         APIRET ret =3D DosSetFilePtr( hFileHandle, 0, SEEK_CUR, &ulPos =
);

         if( ret !=3D 0 )
         {
            ulPos =3D 0;
            s_uiErrorLast =3D ( USHORT ) ret;
         }
      }

   #elif defined(HB_FS_FILE_IO)

      /* get current offset */
      errno =3D 0;
      #if defined(__WIN32__)
         ulPos =3D SetFilePointer( ( HANDLE ) hFileHandle, 0, NULL, =
FILE_CURRENT );
         if ( ulPos =3D=3D 0xFFFFFFFF)
            errno =3D GetLastError();
      #else
         ulPos =3D lseek( hFileHandle, 0, SEEK_CUR );
      #endif
      if( errno !=3D 0 )
      {
         ulPos =3D 0;
         s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
      }
      else
         s_uiErrorLast =3D 25; /* 'Seek Error' */

   #else

      ulPos =3D 0;
      s_uiErrorLast =3D 25; /* 'Seek Error' */

   #endif

   }
   else
   {

   #if defined(HB_OS_OS2)

      {
         APIRET ret =3D DosSetFilePtr( hFileHandle, lOffset, Flags, =
&ulPos );

         if( ret !=3D 0 )
         {
            ulPos =3D 0;
            s_uiErrorLast =3D ( USHORT ) ret;
         }
      }

   #elif defined(HB_FS_FILE_IO)

      errno =3D 0;
      #if defined(__WIN32__)
         ulPos =3D SetFilePointer( ( HANDLE ) hFileHandle, lOffset, =
NULL, Flags );
         if ( ulPos =3D=3D 0xFFFFFFFF)
            errno =3D GetLastError();
      #else
         ulPos =3D lseek( hFileHandle, lOffset, Flags );
      #endif
      if( errno !=3D 0 )
         ulPos =3D 0;
      s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

   #else

      ulPos =3D 0;
      s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

   #endif

      /* Convert 'Unknown Command' to 'Seek Error' */
      if( s_uiErrorLast =3D=3D 22 )
         s_uiErrorLast =3D 25;
   }

   return ulPos;
}

ULONG   hb_fsTell( FHANDLE hFileHandle )
{
   ULONG ulPos;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsTell(%p)", hFileHandle));

#if defined(HB_FS_FILE_IO)

   errno =3D 0;
   #if defined(__WIN32__)
      ulPos =3D SetFilePointer( ( HANDLE ) hFileHandle, 0, NULL, =
FILE_CURRENT );
      if ( ulPos =3D=3D 0xFFFFFFFF)
        errno =3D GetLastError();
   #else
      ulPos =3D lseek( hFileHandle, 0L, SEEK_CUR );
   #endif
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#else

   ulPos =3D 0;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return ulPos;
}

USHORT  hb_fsError( void )
{
   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsError()"));

   return s_uiErrorLast;
}

void    hb_fsSetError( USHORT uiError )
{
   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsSetError(%hu)", uiError));

   s_uiErrorLast =3D uiError;
}

int     hb_fsDelete( BYTE * pFilename )
{
   int iResult;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsDelete(%s)", (char*) pFilename));

#if defined(HAVE_POSIX_IO)

   errno =3D 0;
   iResult =3D unlink( ( char * ) pFilename );
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#elif defined(_MSC_VER) || defined(__MINGW32__)

   errno =3D 0;
   iResult =3D remove( ( char * ) pFilename );
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#else

   iResult =3D -1;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return iResult;
}

int hb_fsRename( BYTE * pOldName, BYTE * pNewName )
{
   int iResult;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsRename(%s, %s)", (char*) pOldName, =
(char*) pNewName));

#if defined(HB_FS_FILE_IO)

   errno =3D 0;
   iResult =3D rename( ( char * ) pOldName, ( char * ) pNewName );
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#else

   iResult =3D -1;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return iResult;
}

BOOL    hb_fsLock   ( FHANDLE hFileHandle, ULONG ulStart,
                      ULONG ulLength, USHORT uiMode )
{
   int iResult;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsLock(%p, %lu, %lu, %hu)", hFileHandle, =
ulStart, ulLength, uiMode));

#if defined(__WIN32__)
   errno =3D 0;
   switch( uiMode )
   {
      case FL_LOCK:
         iResult =3D LockFile( ( HANDLE ) hFileHandle, ulStart, ( =
((long) ulStart) < 0 ? -1 : 0), ulLength, 0 );
         break;

      case FL_UNLOCK:
         iResult =3D UnlockFile( ( HANDLE ) hFileHandle, ulStart, ( =
((long) ulStart) < 0 ? -1 : 0), ulLength, 0 );
         break;

      default:
         iResult =3D 0;
   }
   if ( ! iResult )
      errno =3D GetLastError();
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
#elif defined(HB_OS_OS2)

   {
      struct _FILELOCK fl, ful;

      errno =3D 0;

      switch( uiMode )
      {
      case FL_LOCK:

         fl.lOffset =3D ulStart;
         fl.lRange =3D ulLength;
         ful.lOffset =3D 0;
         ful.lRange =3D 0;

         /* lock region, 2 seconds timeout, exclusive access - no atomic =
*/
         iResult =3D ( int ) DosSetFileLocks( hFileHandle, &ful, &fl, =
2000L, 0L );
         break;

      case FL_UNLOCK:

         fl.lOffset =3D 0;
         fl.lRange =3D 0;
         ful.lOffset =3D ulStart;
         ful.lRange =3D ulLength;

         /* unlock region, 2 seconds timeout, exclusive access - no =
atomic */
         iResult =3D ( int ) DosSetFileLocks( hFileHandle, &ful, &fl, =
2000L, 0L );
         break;

      default:
         iResult =3D 0;
      }

      s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
   }

#elif defined(_MSC_VER)

   {
      ULONG ulOldPos =3D hb_fsSeek( hFileHandle, ulStart, FS_SET );

      errno =3D 0;
      switch( uiMode )
      {
         case FL_LOCK:
            iResult =3D locking( hFileHandle, _LK_LOCK, ulLength );
            break;

         case FL_UNLOCK:
            iResult =3D locking( hFileHandle, _LK_UNLCK, ulLength );
            break;

         default:
            iResult =3D 0;
      }
      s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

      hb_fsSeek( hFileHandle, ulOldPos, FS_SET );
   }

#elif defined(__MINGW32__)

   {
      ULONG ulOldPos =3D hb_fsSeek( hFileHandle, ulStart, FS_SET );

      errno =3D 0;
      switch( uiMode )
      {
         case FL_LOCK:
            iResult =3D _locking( hFileHandle, _LK_LOCK, ulLength );
            break;

         case FL_UNLOCK:
            iResult =3D _locking( hFileHandle, _LK_UNLOCK, ulLength );
            break;

         default:
            iResult =3D 0;
      }
      s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

      hb_fsSeek( hFileHandle, ulOldPos, FS_SET );
   }

#elif defined(__GNUC__) && defined(HB_OS_UNIX)

   {
      /* TODO: check for append locks (SEEK_END)
       */
      struct flock lock_info;

      errno =3D 0;

      switch( uiMode )
      {
         case FL_LOCK:
            {
               lock_info.l_type   =3D F_WRLCK;
               lock_info.l_start  =3D ulStart;
               lock_info.l_len    =3D ulLength;
               lock_info.l_whence =3D SEEK_SET;   /* start from the =
beginning of the file */
               lock_info.l_pid    =3D getpid();

               iResult =3D fcntl( hFileHandle, F_SETLK, &lock_info );

               if( iResult < 0 )
                  iResult =3D 1;         /* lock failed */
               else
                  iResult =3D 0;         /* lock was successful */
            }
            break;

         case FL_UNLOCK:
            {
               lock_info.l_type   =3D F_UNLCK;   /* unlock */
               lock_info.l_start  =3D ulStart;
               lock_info.l_len    =3D ulLength;
               lock_info.l_whence =3D SEEK_SET;
               lock_info.l_pid    =3D getpid();

               iResult =3D fcntl( hFileHandle, F_SETLK, &lock_info );

               if( iResult < 0 )
                  iResult =3D 0;      /* lock failed */
            }
            break;

         default:
            iResult =3D 0;
      }

      s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
   }

#elif defined(HAVE_POSIX_IO) && !defined(__IBMCPP__) && ( =
!defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__DJGPP__) )

   errno =3D 0;
   switch( uiMode )
   {
      case FL_LOCK:
         iResult =3D lock( hFileHandle, ulStart, ulLength );
         break;

      case FL_UNLOCK:
         iResult =3D unlock( hFileHandle, ulStart, ulLength );
         break;

      default:
         iResult =3D 0;
   }
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#else

   iResult =3D 1;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return iResult =3D=3D 0;
}

void    hb_fsCommit( FHANDLE hFileHandle )
{
   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsCommit(%p)", hFileHandle));

#if defined(__WIN32__)

   errno =3D 0;
   if ( !FlushFileBuffers( ( HANDLE ) hFileHandle ) )
      errno =3D GetLastError();
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#elif defined(__WATCOMC__)

   _dos_commit( hFileHandle );

#elif defined(HB_FS_FILE_IO) && !defined(HB_OS_OS2) && =
!defined(HB_OS_UNIX)

   {
      int dup_handle;

      errno =3D 0;

      dup_handle =3D dup( hFileHandle );
      if( dup_handle !=3D -1 )
         close( dup_handle );

      s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
   }

#elif defined(HB_OS_OS2)

   {
      errno =3D 0;

      /* TODO: what about error code from DosResetBuffer() call? */
      DosResetBuffer( hFileHandle );

      s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
   }

#elif defined(HB_OS_UNIX)

   /* NOTE: close() functions releases all lock regardles if it is an
    * original or duplicated file handle
   */
   #if defined(_POSIX_SYNCHRONIZED_IO)
      /* faster - flushes data buffers only, without updating directory =
info
      */
      s_uiErrorLast =3D ( fdatasync( hFileHandle ) < -1 ) ? FS_ERROR : =
0;
   #else
      /* slower - flushes all file data buffers and i-node info
      */
      s_uiErrorLast =3D ( fsync( hFileHandle ) < -1 ) ? FS_ERROR : 0;
   #endif

#else

   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif
}

BOOL    hb_fsMkDir( BYTE * pDirname )
{
   int iResult;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsMkDir(%s)", (char*) pDirname));

#if defined(HAVE_POSIX_IO) || defined(__MINGW32__)

   errno =3D 0;

   #if !defined(__WATCOMC__) && !defined(__BORLANDC__) && =
!defined(__IBMCPP__) && !defined(__MINGW32__)
      iResult =3D mkdir( ( char * ) pDirname, S_IWUSR | S_IRUSR );
   #else
      iResult =3D mkdir( ( char * ) pDirname );
   #endif

   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#else

   iResult =3D 1;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return iResult =3D=3D 0;
}

BOOL    hb_fsChDir( BYTE * pDirname )
{
   int iResult;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsChDir(%s)", (char*) pDirname));

#if defined(HAVE_POSIX_IO) || defined(__MINGW32__)

   errno =3D 0;
   iResult =3D chdir( ( char * ) pDirname );
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#else

   iResult =3D 1;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return iResult =3D=3D 0;
}

BOOL    hb_fsRmDir( BYTE * pDirname )
{
   int iResult;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsRmDir(%s)", (char*) pDirname));

#if defined(HAVE_POSIX_IO) || defined(__MINGW32__)

   errno =3D 0;
   iResult =3D rmdir( ( char * ) pDirname );
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#else

   iResult =3D 1;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return iResult =3D=3D 0;
}

/* NOTE: This is not thread safe function, it's there for compatibility. =
*/
/* NOTE: 0 =3D current drive, 1 =3D A, 2 =3D B, 3 =3D C, etc. */

BYTE *  hb_fsCurDir( USHORT uiDrive )
{
   static BYTE s_byDirBuffer[ _POSIX_PATH_MAX + 1 ];

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsCurDir(%hu)", uiDrive));

   hb_fsCurDirBuff( uiDrive, s_byDirBuffer, _POSIX_PATH_MAX + 1 );

   return ( BYTE * ) s_byDirBuffer;
}

/* NOTE: Thread safe version of hb_fsCurDir() */
/* NOTE: 0 =3D current drive, 1 =3D A, 2 =3D B, 3 =3D C, etc. */

USHORT  hb_fsCurDirBuff( USHORT uiDrive, BYTE * pbyBuffer, ULONG ulLen )
{
   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsCurDirBuff(%hu)", uiDrive));

   HB_SYMBOL_UNUSED( uiDrive );

   pbyBuffer[ 0 ] =3D '\0';

#if defined(HAVE_POSIX_IO)

   errno =3D 0;
   getcwd( ( char * ) pbyBuffer, ulLen );
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#elif defined(__MINGW32__)

   errno =3D 0;
   _getdcwd( uiDrive, pbyBuffer, ulLen );
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#else

   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   /* Strip the leading drive spec, and leading backslash if there's =
one. */

   {
      BYTE * pbyStart =3D pbyBuffer;

      /* NOTE: A trailing underscore is not returned on this platform,
               so we don't need to strip it. [vszakats] */

      if( pbyStart[ 1 ] =3D=3D ':' )
         pbyStart +=3D 2;
      if( strchr( OS_PATH_DELIMITER_LIST, pbyStart[ 0 ] ) )
         pbyStart++;

      if( pbyBuffer !=3D pbyStart )
         memmove( pbyBuffer, pbyStart, ulLen );
   }

   /* Strip the trailing (back)slash if there's one */

   {
      ULONG ulLen =3D strlen( ( char * ) pbyBuffer );

      if( strchr( OS_PATH_DELIMITER_LIST, pbyBuffer[ ulLen - 1 ] ) )
         pbyBuffer[ ulLen - 1 ] =3D '\0';
   }

   return s_uiErrorLast;
}

/* NOTE: 0=3DA:, 1=3DB:, 2=3DC:, 3=3DD:, ... */

USHORT  hb_fsChDrv( BYTE nDrive )
{
   USHORT uiResult;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsChDrv(%d)", (int) nDrive));

#if defined(HB_FS_DRIVE_LETTER)

 #if defined( __WATCOMC__ )

   {
      /* 'unsigned int' _have to_ be used in Watcom
       */
      unsigned int uiSave;
      unsigned int uiTotal;

      /* 1 =3D A:, 2 =3D B:, 3 =3D C:, etc
       * _dos_*() functions don't set 'errno'
       */
      _dos_getdrive( &uiSave );

      _dos_setdrive( nDrive + 1, &uiTotal );
      _dos_getdrive( &uiTotal );
      if( ( nDrive + 1 ) =3D=3D uiTotal )
      {
         uiResult =3D 0;
         s_uiErrorLast =3D 0;
      }
      else
      {
         _dos_setdrive( uiSave, &uiTotal );
         uiResult =3D FS_ERROR;
         s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;
      }
   }
 #else
   {
      USHORT uiSave =3D _getdrive();

      errno =3D 0;
      _chdrive( nDrive + 1 );
      if( ( nDrive + 1 ) =3D=3D _getdrive() )
      {
         uiResult =3D 0;
         s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
      }
      else
      {
         _chdrive( uiSave );
         uiResult =3D FS_ERROR;
         s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;
      }
   }
 #endif
#else

   uiResult =3D FS_ERROR;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return uiResult;
}

/* NOTE: 0=3DA:, 1=3DB:, 2=3DC:, 3=3DD:, ... */

/* TOFIX: This isn't fully compliant because CA-Cl*pper doesn't access
          the drive before checking. hb_fsIsDrv only returns TRUE
          if there is a disk in the drive. */

USHORT  hb_fsIsDrv( BYTE nDrive )
{
   USHORT uiResult;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsIsDrv(%d)", (int) nDrive));

#if defined(HB_FS_DRIVE_LETTER)

 #if defined( __WATCOMC__ )

   {
      /* 'unsigned int' _have to_ be used in Watcom
       */
      unsigned int uiSave;
      unsigned int uiTotal;

      /* 1=3D  A:, 2 =3D B:, 3 =3D C:, etc
       * _dos_*() functions don't set 'errno'
       */
      _dos_getdrive( &uiSave );

      s_uiErrorLast =3D 0;
      uiResult =3D 0;
      _dos_setdrive( nDrive + 1, &uiTotal );
      _dos_getdrive( &uiTotal );
      if( ( nDrive + 1 ) !=3D uiTotal )
      {
         s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;
         uiResult =3D FS_ERROR;
      }
      _dos_setdrive( uiSave, &uiTotal );
   }
 #else
   {
      USHORT uiSave =3D _getdrive();

      errno =3D 0;
      _chdrive( nDrive + 1 );
      if( ( nDrive + 1 ) =3D=3D _getdrive() )
      {
         uiResult =3D 0;
         s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
      }
      else
      {
         uiResult =3D FS_ERROR;
         s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;
      }

      _chdrive( uiSave );
   }
 #endif

#else

   uiResult =3D FS_ERROR;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return uiResult;
}

BOOL    hb_fsIsDevice( FHANDLE hFileHandle )
{
   BOOL bResult;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsIsDevice(%p)", hFileHandle));

#if defined(HB_FS_DRIVE_LETTER)

   errno =3D 0;
   bResult =3D ( isatty( hFileHandle ) =3D=3D 0 );
   s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;

#else

   bResult =3D FALSE;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;
   HB_SYMBOL_UNUSED( hFileHandle );

#endif

   return bResult;
}

/* NOTE: 0=3DA:, 1=3DB:, 2=3DC:, 3=3DD:, ... */

BYTE    hb_fsCurDrv( void )
{
   USHORT uiResult;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsCurDrv()"));

#if defined(HB_FS_DRIVE_LETTER)

   {
      errno =3D 0;
      uiResult =3D _getdrive();
      #if defined(__DJGPP__)
         /* _getdrive() returned a drive number, base 0. */
      #else
      if( uiResult < 65 )
      {
         /* _getdrive() returned a drive number, base 1. */
         uiResult--;
      }
      else
      {
         /* _getdrive() returned a drive letter. */
         uiResult -=3D 65;
      }
      #endif
      s_uiErrorLast =3D errno;
   }

#elif defined( __WATCOMC__ )

   {
      /* 'unsigned int' _have to_ be used in Watcom
       */
      unsigned uiDrive;

      /* 1 =3D A:, 2 =3D B:, 3 =3D C:, etc
       * _dos_*() functions don't set 'errno'
       */
      _dos_getdrive( &uiDrive );
      s_uiErrorLast =3D 0;
      uiResult =3D ( USHORT ) uiDrive -1;
   }

#else

   uiResult =3D 0;
   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

#endif

   return ( BYTE ) uiResult; /* Return the drive number, base 0. */
}

/* TODO: Implement hb_fsExtOpen */

FHANDLE hb_fsExtOpen( BYTE * pFilename, BYTE * pDefExt,
                      USHORT uiFlags, BYTE * pPaths, PHB_ITEM pError )
{
   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsExtOpen(%s, %s, %hu, %p, %p)", (char*) =
pFilename, (char*) pDefExt, uiFlags, pPaths, pError));

   s_uiErrorLast =3D FS_ERROR;

   HB_SYMBOL_UNUSED( pFilename );
   HB_SYMBOL_UNUSED( pDefExt );
   HB_SYMBOL_UNUSED( uiFlags );
   HB_SYMBOL_UNUSED( pPaths );
   HB_SYMBOL_UNUSED( pError );

   return s_uiErrorLast;
}

/* TOFIX: CA-Cl*pper will allow wildcards in the filename. This should =
be
          added to Harbour. [vszakats] */

BOOL hb_fsFile( BYTE * pFilename )
{
   BOOL bIsFile;

   HB_TRACE(HB_TR_DEBUG, ("hb_fsFile(%s)", (char*) pFilename));

/* TODO: Check if F_OK is defined in all compilers */
#if defined(OS_UNIX_COMPATIBLE)

   bIsFile =3D ( access( ( const char * ) pFilename, F_OK ) =3D=3D 0 );

#elif defined(__MPW__)
   {
      int hFileHandle;

      if( ( hFileHandle =3D open( pFilename, O_RDONLY ) ) >=3D 0 )
      {
         close( hFileHandle );
         bIsFile =3D TRUE;
      }
      else
         bIsFile =3D FALSE;
   }
#else

   bIsFile =3D ( access( ( const char * ) pFilename, 0 ) =3D=3D 0 );

#endif

   return bIsFile;
}

BOOL hb_fsEof( FHANDLE hFileHandle )
{
#if defined(__WIN32__)
   long curPos =3D SetFilePointer( ( HANDLE ) hFileHandle, 0, NULL, =
FILE_CURRENT );
   long endPos =3D SetFilePointer( ( HANDLE ) hFileHandle, 0, NULL, =
FILE_END );
   long newPos =3D SetFilePointer( ( HANDLE ) hFileHandle, curPos, NULL, =
FILE_BEGIN );
   if( newPos =3D=3D -1L )
   {
      errno =3D GetLastError();
      hb_fsSetError( errno );
   }
   else if( newPos !=3D curPos )
   {
      hb_fsSetError( FS_ERROR );
   }
   return curPos >=3D endPos;
#elif defined(__DJGPP__) || defined(__CYGWIN__) || =
defined(OS_UNIX_COMPATIBLE)
   long curPos =3D lseek( hFileHandle, 0L, SEEK_CUR );
   long endPos =3D lseek( hFileHandle, 0L, SEEK_END );
   long newPos =3D lseek( hFileHandle, curPos, SEEK_SET );
   if( newPos =3D=3D -1L )
   {
      hb_fsSetError( errno );
   }
   else if( newPos !=3D curPos )
   {
      hb_fsSetError( FS_ERROR );
   }
   return curPos >=3D endPos;
#else
   return eof( hFileHandle ) !=3D 0;
#endif
}

/*
HB_FUNC( FEOF )
{
   hb_fsSetError( 0 );

   if( ISNUM( 1 ) )
   {
      hb_retl( hb_fsEof( hb_parni( 1 ) ) );
   }
   else
      hb_retl( FALSE );
}
*/

From harbour@matrixlist.com  Fri Mar 30 12:59:02 2001
From: harbour@matrixlist.com (David G. Holm)
Date: Fri Mar 30 12:59:02 2001
Subject: [Harbour] 'contrib' app hooks into harbour
In-Reply-To: <3AC3F2EA.BA40247F@mail.rosecom.ca>
References: <200103280328_MC2-CA56-EDDD@compuserve.com> <200103291551.f2TFpEk17102@smtp.parrett.net>
Message-ID: <200103301755.f2UHtws17966@smtp.parrett.net>

** Reply to message from April <awhite@mail.rosecom.ca> on Thu, 29 Mar
2001 21:43:54 -0500

You need to use two levels of macros:

/* t1.c */

#define INITCNAME Z
#define INITNAME first
#define EXITNAME last

#include "t1.h"

/* t1.h */

#define THB_FUNC( n ) HB_FUNC( n )
#define THB_FUNCNAME( n ) HB_FUNCNAME(n)

#define THB_TO_STRING( n ) THB_AS_STRING( n )
#define THB_AS_STRING( n ) #n

#define THB_TO_SYBMOL_NAME( n ) THB_SYMBOL_NAME( n )
#define THB_SYMBOL_NAME( n ) hb_vm_SymbolInit_##n
#define THB_TO_AUTO_SYMBOL_NAME( n ) THB_AUTO_SYMBOL_NAME( n )
#define THB_AUTO_SYMBOL_NAME( n ) hb_vm_auto_SymbolInit_##n

HB_INIT_SYMBOLS_BEGIN(THB_TO_AUTO_SYMBOL_NAME(INITCNAME))
{ THB_TO_STRING( INITNAME ), HB_FS_INIT, THB_FUNCNAME( INITNAME ), NULL
},
{ THB_TO_STRING( EXITNAME ), HB_FS_EXIT, THB_FUNCNAME( EXITNAME ), NULL
}
HB_INIT_SYMBOLS_END(THB_TO_AUTO_SYMBOL_NAME(INITCNAME))

/* Output from GCC t1.c -E */

# 1 "t1.c"




# 1 "t1.h" 1











HB_INIT_SYMBOLS_BEGIN(hb_vm_auto_SymbolInit_Z      )
{ "first"  , HB_FS_INIT, HB_FUNCNAME(  first   ) , NULL },
{ "last"  , HB_FS_EXIT, HB_FUNCNAME(  last   ) , NULL }
HB_INIT_SYMBOLS_END(hb_vm_auto_SymbolInit_Z      )
# 5 "t1.c" 2
-- 
David G. Holm, Set Captain and all around
Harbour Project Clipper Compatibility fanatic.

From harbour@matrixlist.com  Fri Mar 30 13:37:02 2001
From: harbour@matrixlist.com (Brian Hays)
Date: Fri Mar 30 13:37:02 2001
Subject: [Harbour] Unlimited File Handles
References: <LOBBKAFMMFGJIKLMEPAKOEMCDKAA.Ron@Profit-Master.com> <031101c0b915$43ccf050$f003a8c0@ksoft20000507>
Message-ID: <002701c0b949$47248220$921a5e18@bh>

Horacio:
Thanks for the work on the FS functions!
The main issue I saw (did you see my msg a few weeks ago with several "bug"
reports?) was the compatibility of existing code that uses "clipper" fs
calls for normal handles.

With your proposal, would such code have to be changed to work?  For
example, memoline/mlcount were failing, but also there is also existing
extend system code written by app developers that we probably want to stay
syntactically consistent with.  Are we able to replace all the file system
calls a programmer may have made using a normal handle?

Optimally, Harbour routines would work with the new Handles transparently,
but without removing the ability to use normal handles unless we can also
transparently alter all usage, which seems unlikely.
It just occurred to me that perhaps the Harbour rtl could use one more level
of indirection (perhaps a set of macros) so that the RDD and other routines
could be using the new Handles but the fs* functions themselves would still
use old handles by default ??

I'll take a good look at your post this weekend....

Brian

> Ron (or/and anyone with spare time )

> I fixed the FRead problem (it was actually a FOpen problem), but doing
that
> I discovered other problems with the win32 routines (especially error
> checking).
> I fixed them: (hb_fsClose, hb_fsRead, hb_fsWrite, hb_fsReadLarge,
> hb_fsWriteLarge, hb_fsSeek, hb_fsTell).
>
> Many filesys.c routines works with handles but they didn't had support for
> win32, so they failed as it seems that the "normal" handles (eg: open() )
> are not compatible with the ones from the win32 api (Createfile).
> I added support for: hb_fsEof , hb_fsCommit, hb_fsLock,
convert_seek_flags.
>
> I don't cvs'ed the file because of two reasons:
> - asking for testing (the file is attached)
> - there is still potencial incompatibilities with handles not created with
> hb_fsOpen (I found them in console.c at least)

> keep compatibility with the normal handles. That mark would be a 0x4000:

>   handle_win32 = handle & 0x3FFF; // and routines for win32
> else
>   // normal routines from C compiler

> This should work (unless windows uses a file handle in that range!)
> I would like to hear opinions !

From harbour@matrixlist.com  Sat Mar 31 05:09:02 2001
From: harbour@matrixlist.com (Antonio Linares)
Date: Sat Mar 31 05:09:02 2001
Subject: [Harbour] possible bug reported by a Harbour user
In-Reply-To: <002701c0b949$47248220$921a5e18@bh>
Message-ID: <000201c0b9ca$1613c2a0$0f2aa8c0@antonio>

Hi

Attached sample .prg shows Harbour compiled soft encounters some trouble
while reading .DBF + .NTX up to higher Field count.

Regards

*-------------------------------------------
#include "FiveWin.ch"
*=========================================================
func Main()
*------------------------------------------------------
local  aStru := {}, cFld2, nRec := 60
local  n, m, k, fRec, fA09, YN_Qut := 0
local  aFld[1000,2]
local  cDBF := 'TstNtx.dbf'
local  cNTX := 'TstNtx.Ntx'
field  A0009, cStr := ''

*---------------------------
for m = 2 to 10
   clos all
   for n = 1 to 100 * m
      aFld[n,1] := 'A'+StrZero( n,4 )
      if n % 4 == 1
         if n > 20 .and. n <= 100
            aFld[n,2] := 'C  240,0'
            // I use these fields to save information of PLC scanning
         else
            aFld[n,2] := 'C   20,0'
         endif
      elseif n % 4 == 2
         aFld[n,2] := 'N    9,2'
      elseif n % 4 == 3
         aFld[n,2] := 'D    8,0'
      else
         aFld[n,2] := 'L    3,0'
      endif
   next
   if !File( cDBF ) .or. FErase( cDBF ) == 0
      aStru := {}
      for n = 1 to Len( aFld )
         if Empty( aFld[n,1] )
            exit
         endif
         AADD( aStru, { aFld[n,1],
ubStr( aFld[n,2],1,1 ),Val(SubStr( aFld[n,2],3,4 )), ;
                                    Val(SubStr( aFld[n,2],8,1 )) } )
      next
      DbCreate( cDBF, aStru )
   else
      MsgInfo(  'cannot erase '+cDBF+' Field Count : '+ Str( 100*m , 5 ) )
       exit
   endif
   clos all
   DbSelectArea( 1 )
   use &cDBF shared alias TstNtx
   1->(DbGotop())
   for n = 1 to nRec
      1->(DbAppend())
      for k = 1 to 100 * m
         if ValType( FieldGet(k) ) == 'C'
            1->(FieldPut( k, Chr( 123-n ) + StrZero( n,3 ) ) )
         elseif ValType( FieldGet(k) ) == 'N'
            1->(FieldPut( k, n/0.123 ))
         elseif ValType( FieldGet(k) ) == 'D'
            1->(FieldPut( k, Date() + n ))
         else
            1->(FieldPut( k, .f. ))
         endif
      next
   next
   index on A0009 to &cNTX
   set index to &cNTX
   *---------------
   1->(DbGotop())
   fRec := 1->(RecNo())
   fA09 := 1->A0009
   for n = 1 to nRec
      1->(DbSkip())
      if fRec == 1->(RecNo()) .or. 1->(Eof())
         exit
      endif
      cStr +=  1->A0009 + Str( 1->(RecNo()) )+CRLF
      if n % 20 == 0 .or. fA09 > 1->A0009
         if fA09 > 1->A0009 .and. MsgYesNo(  'Index Disordered, want quit ?
Y/N* ' )
            YN_Qut := 89
            // Harbour Compiled soft returns disorder message here while
            //    field count getting higher
            // Clipper Compiled soft OK Up to 1000 > field count
                 exit
            endif
         else
            MsgInfo( cStr )
            cStr := ''
         endif
      endif
      fRec := 1->(RecNo())
   next
   if YN_Qut == 89
      exit
   endif
   if MsgNoYes( 'Field_Count='+Str( 100*m,4 ) +
'Ntx_Skip_'+Str(nRec,2)+'='+Str( n, 3 )+'   Quit ? '
      exit
   endif
next
close all
release all

retu nil



From harbour@matrixlist.com  Sat Mar 31 05:57:02 2001
From: harbour@matrixlist.com (Alexander S.Kresin)

Subject: [Harbour] Can't compile gtsln ( Marek )

References: <LOBBKAFMMFGJIKLMEPAKOEMCDKAA.Ron@Profit-Master.com>
 <031101c0b915$43ccf050$f003a8c0@ksoft20000507>
 <002701c0b949$47248220$921a5e18@bh>

 Marek,
  I got the following when trying to build Harbour after last changes
  in gtsln, before it was Ok:

../../gtsln.c: In function `hb_gt_build_conv_tabs':
../../gtsln.c:1030: `SLSMG_DIAMOND_CHAR' undeclared (first use in this function)
../../gtsln.c:1030: (Each undeclared identifier is reported only once
../../gtsln.c:1030: for each function it appears in.)
../../gtsln.c:1032: `SLSMG_LARROW_CHAR' undeclared (first use in this function)
../../gtsln.c:1035: `SLSMG_RARROW_CHAR' undeclared (first use in this function)
../../gtsln.c:1038: `SLSMG_DARROW_CHAR' undeclared (first use in this function)
../../gtsln.c:1041: `SLSMG_UARROW_CHAR' undeclared (first use in this function)
make[4]: *** [gtsln.o] Error 1
make[3]: *** [descend] Error 2

From harbour@matrixlist.com  Sat Mar 31 12:35:04 2001
From: harbour@matrixlist.com (=?iso-8859-1?Q?Horacio_Rold=E1n?=)
Date: Sat Mar 31 12:35:04 2001
Subject: [Harbour] Unlimited File Handles
References: <200103301228_MC2-CAC6-4947@compuserve.com>
Message-ID: <034201c0ba08$ca481440$f003a8c0@ksoft20000507>

Yes, I know. It's not a final idea.
I remember having read that Windows error (from GetLastError) codes reserved
a bit (I don't remeber if it was 29 or 30) to mark applications defined
error codes.
So I was wondering if there were some numbers not used by Windows for
handles in the same way.
I don't know this, I just dropped an idea because someone could have a hint
on that.

If that it's not possible, I think we should mantain compatibility with the
fsX function on normal "C" handles and have a different set used of routines
platform especific and #defines for improving performance.

From harbour@matrixlist.com  Sat Mar 31 12:47:02 2001
From: harbour@matrixlist.com (=?iso-8859-1?Q?Horacio_Rold=E1n?=)
Date: Sat Mar 31 12:47:02 2001
Subject: [Harbour] Unlimited File Handles
References: <LOBBKAFMMFGJIKLMEPAKOEMCDKAA.Ron@Profit-Master.com> <031101c0b915$43ccf050$f003a8c0@ksoft20000507> <002701c0b949$47248220$921a5e18@bh>
Message-ID: <034701c0ba0a$7f1d4d80$f003a8c0@ksoft20000507>

The compatibility using the same set of routines could be achieved if
internally in Harbour we could have extra space for marking a Win32 handle.

If Harbour FHANLDE could have space to store the type of handle plus the
hanlde itself it is easy to do the task.
The problem is that the size of a Win32 handle is 4 bytes (it is defined as
a void* ). Have you any ideas on this?

If this is not possible, the idea to have a separate set of functions with
macros to activate them on compile should work fine .

> Are we able to replace all the file system
> calls a programmer may have made using a normal handle?
The functions that receive a handle and aren't Win32 compatible yet are:
hb_fsIsDevice, hb_fsSetDevMode.
The others unchanged functions in filesys do not use a handle and could be
changed later or not.

Horacio

> example, memoline/mlcount were failing, but also there is also existing
> extend system code written by app developers that we probably want to stay
> syntactically consistent with.  Are we able to replace all the file system
> calls a programmer may have made using a normal handle?

> > checking).
> > I fixed them: (hb_fsClose, hb_fsRead, hb_fsWrite, hb_fsReadLarge,
> > hb_fsWriteLarge, hb_fsSeek, hb_fsTell).

References: <LOBBKAFMMFGJIKLMEPAKOEMCDKAA.Ron@Profit-Master.com>
 <031101c0b915$43ccf050$f003a8c0@ksoft20000507>

Alexander,

> Marek,
>   I got the following when trying to build Harbour after last changes
>   in gtsln, before it was Ok:
>
> ../../gtsln.c: In function `hb_gt_build_conv_tabs':
> ../../gtsln.c:1030: `SLSMG_DIAMOND_CHAR' undeclared (first use in this
function)
> ../../gtsln.c:1030: (Each undeclared identifier is reported only once
> ../../gtsln.c:1030: for each function it appears in.)
> ../../gtsln.c:1032: `SLSMG_LARROW_CHAR' undeclared (first use in this
function)
> ../../gtsln.c:1035: `SLSMG_RARROW_CHAR' undeclared (first use in this
function)
> ../../gtsln.c:1038: `SLSMG_DARROW_CHAR' undeclared (first use in this
function)
> ../../gtsln.c:1041: `SLSMG_UARROW_CHAR' undeclared (first use in this
function)
> make[4]: *** [gtsln.o] Error 1
> make[3]: *** [descend] Error 2

Yes, it is possible.

I am working with Slang 1.4.4 localy and I have them defined in slang.h.
This is why I enabled them in current version of gtsln. Previously they were 
marked as a comment. I did not try to compile it with previous versions of 
Slang (sorry, my error) but I've checked this and at least they are defined 
in Slang 1.4.1. Unfortunately I can not check previous versions because 
I've simply removed them (I consider them as old versions).
So I suppose You are using a Slang version prior to 1.4.1

A simple fix, which should be enough, is below :
( replace lines in  gtsln from line 1030 to 1043
  or simply add a conditional directive )

------------------ cut ----------------------------

#if SLANG_VERSION > 10400     /* this is a new line which should be added */
            case SLSMG_DIAMOND_CHAR :  s_convHighChars[ 04 ] = SLch;
                                       break;
            case SLSMG_LARROW_CHAR  :  s_convHighChars[ 17 ] = SLch;
                                       s_convHighChars[ 27 ] = SLch;
                                       break;
            case SLSMG_RARROW_CHAR  :  s_convHighChars[ 16 ] = SLch;
                                       s_convHighChars[ 26 ] = SLch;
                                       break;
            case SLSMG_DARROW_CHAR  :  s_convHighChars[ 25 ] = SLch;
                                       s_convHighChars[ 31 ] = SLch;
                                       break;
            case SLSMG_UARROW_CHAR  :  s_convHighChars[ 24 ] = SLch;
                                       s_convHighChars[ 30 ] = SLch;
                                       break;
#endif           /* this is a new line which should be added */

------------------ cut ----------------------------

If this will work could You update a CVS ? I would be appreciate.

Regards
Marek Paliwoda






From harbour@matrixlist.com  Sat Mar 31 14:34:02 2001
From: harbour@matrixlist.com (Brian Hays)
Date: Sat Mar 31 14:34:02 2001
Subject: [Harbour] gps and orphaned processes
Message-ID: <000901c0ba1a$7a03a870$921a5e18@bh>

Our large Harbour/FW app intermittently gpfs.  When it does, we only get
data on the secondary errors that follow.  The result for the user is a
msgbox that shows an "impossible" stack call list.  In one example, our
public variable that maintains the main frame window object is replaced by
another object, so in
    oMainWnd:MainWndIvar
The error reported is
    SomeOtherObject:MainWndIvar --- Message Not Found

Another example is that, instead of a window object being correctly pulled
out of an array of objects, some other object gets sent the message:
    SomeOtherObject:HandleEvent() --- Message Not Found

What's worse is the app window closes after the msgbox is closed, but a
process is left running in the background eating cpu cycles.  This is of
course unacceptable error handling for me to give to my clients, especially
since WIn98 has no way to clear that process without rebooting.

We are doing everything we can to isolate what may lead to this memory
corruption -- more on this later.

But does anyone have any ideas how to trap and clean up the errors
effectively?  What can we do to be sure that at least the app fully unloads
from memory?  Any tips on how the error system could reveal the primary
errors earlier?  What code could I add to the vm or class source allow us to
trace back and identify the memory errors?

Brian Hays

From harbour@matrixlist.com  Sat Mar 31 23:19:02 2001
From: harbour@matrixlist.com (April)
Date: Sat Mar 31 23:19:02 2001
Subject: [Harbour] init & exit procs...
Message-ID: <3AC6AD12.2F337392@mail.rosecom.ca>

I've been playing a bit more with init/exit within C, but I do have a
question or two about prgs:

1.  there is a symbol HB_FS_INITEXIT (hbvmpub.h), but a small note in
genc.c states:
"Since the normal function cannot be INIT and EXIT at the same time
 we are using these two bits to mark the special function used to
 initialize static variables"

    - is this really a bad thing?  could not a hand-created init c
      routine not also be defined as a exit routine?  ie. if the 
      static control var is zero this must be init, else exit

2. are init/term procs in the symbol table?  They might be since there
is a call to hb_vmProcessSymbols() with the proc symbols.  I tried a 
'static init' proc test and received a compiler warning for my troubles.

3. Is there a need for the hb_vm_auto_SymbolInit_*** symbol to be
unique? As far as I can tell, it is created from the source filename 
for a static constructor function.  Might it be enough to merge the 
name of the init and exit procs together?  I am looking at this as 
a means to replace the third #define needed to create a unique 
hb_vm_auto_SymbolInit_*** symbol name.

Thanks.
